Subject: RE: [rest-discuss] Resources and URIs

> It seems to me that this kind of thing (deleting part of a resource
> state) is best done by either explicitly identifying the part 
> you want to DELETE as a regular resource, or by allowing a 
> query part to identify the state you want to DELETE. Either 
> <http://example.com/parts/0034/screw1> or 
> <http://example.com/parts/0034?screw=1> would be fine.
Both of these are identifying part 0034 as a regular resource. The presence
of question mark doesn't make a URI a different type of resource.
